utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hey Joey, how'd the audition go?

utterance.speaker: ALL

utterance.content: Yeah, there's just one thing that might be kind've a problem. See, I, uh, had to kiss this guy.

utterance.content: 'Cause he was just so darn cute.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No, as part of the audition. See, I'm up for this part of this guy, who the main guy kisses.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, hey. You're an actor, I say you just suck it up and do it. Or you just do it.

utterance.content: Then what's the problem?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: See after the scene, Mr. Beatty comes up to me and says 'good actor, bad kisser'. Can you believe that, me not a good kisser, that's like, like Mother Theresa, not a good mother.

utterance.content: Well, come on, who cares what that guy thinks. What does Warren Beatty know about kissing Ooh.

utterance.content: Hey, what did your agent say?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yep, this kiss thing is defiantly a problem, Mr. Beatty wants to see it again on Monday. Man, I gotta figure out what I'm doing wrong. Oh, okay, one of you girls come over here and kiss me.

utterance.content: All right. I'll do it, I kissed him before I can do it again.

utterance.content: Yeah, well you promised Barry, you'd marry him.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Look you guys, I have to go, I'm the Maid-of-Honor. And besides you know what I just need to be in a room again with these people and feel good about myself.

utterance.speaker: MONICA

utterance.content: I like this girl, okay, I seriously like this girl, you now how sometimes I tend get a little defended and quipy...

utterance.content: Nooo!

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Nooo! Never! I mean, we're living in the moment. God, it is so nice for once to not have to get all hung up on 'Where is this going?'

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Afraid to ask him?

utterance.content: Could not be more terrified.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, I think you should seriously consider the marriage thing, give Rachel another chance to dress up like Princess Bubble Yum.

utterance.content: Where's Benny? There he is! Where's Benny, there he is.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Awww! You know that's probably why babies learn to talk, so they can tell grown ups to cut it out.

utterance.content: Hey, you know I got a question for ya. Just a little thing, no pressure.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.content: Sure I do.

utterance.content: Honey, you are in it.

utterance.content: Oh God, you are about to get sooo lucky.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Oh, yeah!

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Keep talkin'.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Well, uh, sometimes I think about selling my practice, we could move to France, make French toast.

utterance.content: Okay, so, uh, we're in France, we're making the toast. Do you see a little bassinet in the corner?

utterance.content: Well, I just think the baby would keep falling off the dog. Do you, uh, do you , do you not see kids in our future.

utterance.content: Oh, hey. I love children, I have children. I just don't want to be 70 when our kids go off to college, and our lives can finally start.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Look I want you, now.

utterance.speaker: JOEY

utterance.content: So, I read this article in the paper the other day that says you're not supposed to throw rice at weddings, because when pigeons eat rice it kills them.

utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.content: Yeah, when I was in the bathroom I saw the window that I crawled out of at my wedding, and God, I just started thinking that I shouldn't be here, you know I shouldn't, people are going to be looking at me and judging me and, and thinking about the last time.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Sweetie, it's be gonna okay, all right. It's a wedding, generally people focus on the bride.
